docs.title: 0. Copy the Dotting Script to the correct Location
docs.text:
Place Dotting Script into the Acrobat JavaScript directory. Note that the directory will be named the same as the version of acrobat you are using and may vary among different operating systems. For the latest Acrobat DC on Windows it should be:

C:\Program Files\Adobe\Acrobat DC\Acrobat\Javascripts

docs.title: 1. Revert to classic interface
docs.text: If you have a recent version of Acrobat DC you'll also get the new user interface, which is somehow disorienting and slower for our task. To revert to the classic Acrobat interface, open Acrobat Pro, select the hamburger menu and choose Disable the new Acrobat.

docs.title: 2. Update Acrobat
docs.text: Open the Help menu and select Check for updates. Apply updates if needed and restart Acrobat.

docs.title: 3. Access Preferences Menu
docs.text: Edit > Preferences > General... or use the Ctrl + K shortcut to access the Preference Menu.

docs.title: 4. General settings
docs.text: Stop Acrobat from generating URLs links in distilled papers. (Uncheck “Create links from URLs”):

docs.title: 5. Page display
docs.text: Display fonts using the fonts in the PDF not local fonts. (Uncheck “Use local fonts”):

docs.title: 6. Content Editing
docs.text:
Make sure Adobe Acrobat displays this as they are. (Uncheck “Enable Artificial Bold/Italic Styles”):

While editing if you accidentally type changing text in the PDF you may not notice, by setting the editing text and add text to Wingdings 36 font size it will be obvious immediately:

docs.title: 7. Convert From PDF
docs.text:
Include all fonts during embedding. In the Encapsulated PostScript drop down menu Font inclusion > Embedded and Referenced Fonts, Uncheck Convert TrueType to Type 1:

Setup the PostScript/EPS settings to use the JACoW.joboptions Note: Before do this step must be setup the Adobe Acrobat Distiller DC first.

docs.title: 8. Convert to PDF
docs.text: Setup the PNG Grayscale and Color to High Quality:

docs.title: 8. Identity
docs.text: Place your name in the identity Name field which will be printed on the top of the page when you print a dotted paper:

docs.text: JavaScript > JavaScript Security > Check Enable menu items JavaScript execution privileges.

This will explain who to add the JACoW-12 options to the distiller etc.

docs.title: Default browser && plugins
docs.text:
1. Set Firefox as default browser

  2. Check for updates and install if needed. Restart to apply them.

  3. Install the following plug-ins:

    1. Foxy gestures

    2. uBlock origin

  4. Set your special IPAC instructions page as Firefox's homepage (e.g.: IPAC'25's).

docs.title: Set Acrobat as default PDF application
docs.text:
You should set Acrobat as the PDF viewer to handle PDF files in FF. To switch from from the built-in PDF viewer:

  1. Click the hamburger menu and select Settings.
  2. In the General panel, go down to the Applications section.
  3. Find Portable Document Format (PDF) in the list and click on the entry to select it.
  4. Click on the arrow under the Action column for the above entry and select the User other... from the drop-down menu.
  5. Select Adobe Acrobat and confirm.

docs.title: Font Installation
docs.text:
We need some particular fonts for our editing. In detail:

  1. Barcode font to print the papers at the proceedings office

  2. Embeddable symbol font

  3. Liberation Mono for the URLs and DOIs (Word)

The first two are available in the AcrobatPitStopTools, the latter on Download the fonts from the Free Best Fonts website.

To install them select all font files, right-click and select Install for all users:

docs.title: Update MiKTeX
docs.text:
First of all, update MiKTeX by running this command in your terminal:

    miktex packages update

Important!

This command must be run at least twice (continue until you see no packages updated anymore)

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
MiKTeX is to be installed in User mode (not Admin mode)

Admin Mode leads to package load errors and a mix-up when users are not logged in as Administrators and the flag on “Always” is not set correctly (which requires Admin privs when installing).

Select Settings and configure as per screenshot:

docs.title: Enfocus PitStop Activation Process
docs.text:
Tested on PitStop version 21.3.0

Select the menu Help > About Third-Party Plug-Ins > About Enfocus PitStop Pro.

Select Offline Activation

Click Start Trial.

Enter your Enfocus ID then click Start Trial.

Save your Activation Request file to your computer.

Click the link to the offline activation Enfocus webpage. Then Browse to select the Activation Request file on your computer:

Enter your Enfocus ID (e-mail) and password:

Then click Continue to finally activate PitStop.

After having it activated, download the registration file:

Then load the Activation Response file:

Now you can finally celebrate your success:

docs.title: Load Enfocus PitStop JACoW Media Box
docs.text:
In Acrobat, open the Action Lists option from the PitStop Pro menu.

Locate file and click Open.

and your action list is ready for use!
